floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message: Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels are high but are gradually falling on the river Churn as a result of previous heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue, especially in the Cerney Wick area. The weather forecast tonight, 01/12/23 and tomorrow is dry. We expect river levels to continue to fall slowly over the next few days. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 2/12/23, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Thames and its small tributaries from Calcutt to Lechlade

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thames, Blunsdon Brook, Water Eaton Brook, Marston Meysey Brook, Share Ditch, Bydemill Brook, Westrop Brook, Downington Brook

items.message: Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels  remain high but are falling steadily along the River Thames and Small tributaries as a result of previous heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is possible. The weather forecast tonight, 01/12/23 and tomorrow is dry. We expect river levels to continue to fall slowly over the next few days. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 2/12/23, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is likely today, Friday 1st December and for the next few days. Water levels continue to remain high in this area. This is due to a natural tide locking effect. Tidal water moving up the rivers from Great Yarmouth, restricts the normal drainage out to sea at low tide, of the Broads river system. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  The recent series of high spring tides has now peaked, and will fall away over the next few days, allowing the freshwater river flows to drain out to sea at low tide as normal again. Take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are closely monitoring the situation. We will update this message on Saturday 2nd December, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Hull, Holderness Drain, Barmston Drain

items.message: River levels remain high on the River Hull and Roam Drain and areas around Wilfholme due to recent rainfall. No further significant rainfall is forecast over the coming days. We will continue to monitor levels closely. Avoid using low-lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses, and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 5pm on 02/12/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Thame, Horsenden Stream and Chalgrove Brook

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thame, Horsenden Stream, Chalgrove Brook

items.message: Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels have fallen on the River Thame but remain high on the Chalgrove Brook as a result of previous heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is possible, especially in the Chalgrove area. The weather forecast tonight, 01/12/23 and tomorrow is dry. We expect river levels to continue to fall slowly over the next few days. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 2/12/23, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire, York

items.message: This flood alert is no longer in force due to improving conditions and river levels dropping. We will continue to monitor the situation and re-issue if necessary.

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council, Hampshire

items.message:
River levels remain high but steady on the Middle and Lower Hampshire Avon due to raised groundwater levels.

Areas most at risk include tributaries between Ringwood and Christchurch.

Further rainfall is forecast at the weekend and we are monitoring the situation.  

No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.

This message will be updated by 11:00 AM on 02/12/2023, or as the situation changes.

Flood alert area: Tributaries between Ringwood and Christchurch.

River levels remain high but steady on the River Piddle.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Piddle, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Alton Pancras and Wareham.

Further rainfall is forecast for the weekend and we will be monitoring the situation.  

River levels are expected to remain high.

We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.

This message will be updated by 11:00 AM on 02/12/2023, or as the situation changes.

Flood alert area: Tributaries between Alton Pancras and Wareham.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Upper Og Valley
items.message: Groundwater levels have responded to rainfall over the past few weeks and remain high at our observation borehole in Draycot Foliat in the Og Valley area. Groundwater levels are above normal for this time of year and remain at a level where communities may be affected by flooding from groundwater over the coming weeks.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message:
The River Yeo level at Huish Episcopi Pumping Station is 7.28 m and is generally falling slowly. The drain level is 7.03 m and continues to fall slowly.

Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if this level exceeds 7.30 m, the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86 m, and the road from Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93 m. 

The forecast is mainly dry today, Friday 1/12/2023, and tomorrow, Saturday, with possible showers by evening. Rain or sleet is forecast for Sunday through to Monday. The River Yeo continues to fall slowly and occasionally fluctuates in response to pumping changes elsewhere in the river system. We are continuing to pump to evacuate the remaining water from the Moors.

The situation is being monitored and staff are checking the condition of flood banks, spillways and weed screens. Please refer to @TravelSomerset for information on local road closures.
For water levels on the rivers, please refer to our website: (check-for-flooding.service.gov.uk/river-and-sea-levels).

This message will be updated by 15:00 on Saturday 2/12/2023.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in Finchdean, Dean Lane End and Rowlands Castle
items.message: In Finchdean, Dean Lane End and Rowlands Castle, groundwater levels are high and rising slowly. Since Friday 24/11/2023, 22mm of rain has been recorded at Walderton. The groundwater level at our borehole in Finchdean has risen by 1.06m in that time. The Idsworth Lavant is now flowing through all villages. Pumps used to reduce water levels will be required for a small number of properties in Finchdean and surface water could flood property during heavier rain events. From today 30/11/2023 until Saturday 02/12/2023, only very small amounts of rain are forecast. On Sunday 03/12/2023 and Monday 04/12/2023, up to 20mm per day is forecast in Hampshire. If heavy rain affects the area then groundwater will continue to rise and more properties could be affected. If not, then groundwater levels are expected to peak in the next couple of days. We are liaising with the Flood Action Group. If you use pumps to reduce water levels, please ensure they are operational. Further groundwater flooding impacts are likely this winter. This Flood Alert will be updated at 17:00 on Thursday 07/12/2023.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Lambourn Valley catchment
items.message: Groundwater levels have responded to the recent rainfall across the area and have risen at our observation borehole in Longacre in the Lambourn Valley. Groundwater levels are above normal for this time of year and have now reached a level where communities may be affected within the next few days by flooding from groundwater.
